intro: Clitandra buchananii, commonly known as the African rosewood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and elliptical leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
